Dumfries and Galloway – Sanquhar library, registration service and council customer service centre to be combined.
Kensington and Chelsea – North Kensington Library to be leased to private school: library to move to a combined gym/youth centre.

Blackpool – £85k cut: opening hours reduced from 307 a week to 266-and-a-half. Anchorsholme Library to experiment with café to see if it boosts income. Further £100k cut threatened: volunteers or income or further cuts will be answer.
Somerset – Shepton Mallet Library may co-locate into business centre "Shape Hub"
Merton – Nominated for best council services team in the UK by the MJ.
Bradford – Shipley Library reopens after £640k refurbishment. Meeting rooms improved. Social services to share space.
Lancashire – 29 libraries (was 40) confirmed as being under threat.
Herefordshire – Hereford Central Library unlikely to reopen until 2017: repairs will cost at least £500k.

East Riding of Yorkshire – £1.2m cut: mobile library service to be reduced, North Bridlington Library to become an adult education and training centre (and cease as a library). Several libraries to be co-located with other council services.
Enfield – Ponders End Library to include Age UK local headquarters, Enfield Highway Library to include public health services department.
North Lanarkshire – 4 libraries (Petersburn, Old Monkland, Craigneuk and Newarthill) to close and 2 mobiles: £1m cut to Leisure Trust plus £450k extra cost pressures.  Consultation.
Warrington – Nine libraries to have reduced hours: LiveWire Trust blames reduction in usage. No reductions in contracted staffing but will need to work at any library in borough.

Northern Ireland – 14 libraries to have opening hours reduced to 45 hours per week (some of these cut by 9 hours), £2m cut to £27.7m in 2016/17. Consultation. "A total of 309,756 people used libraries in 2014-15, an increase of 3% from 2013-14."
Norfolk – Opening hours and access reduced at Norwich Millennium Library: Open+ introduced.
Kent – £1.7m cut over Libraries/Registration/Archives service. Mobile library service to be cut by £150k with all stops with average of two or less users.
Suffolk – Suffolk Coastal District Council putting staff into Woodbridge Library.
Enfield – £4.2m "transformation" of Edmonton Green Library planned: with added IT Centre, study spaces, local history and museum.
Moray – 6 out of 11 Iibraries may close, £93k annual cut.
Vale of Glamorgan – Libraries budget cut by £525k budget £2,051,000 in 2016/17
